meanings.definition: To be carried along by currents of air or water.
meanings.sent1: The fallen leaf will drift gently on the calm river.
meanings.sent2: The boat began to drift aimlessly in the open sea.
meanings.sent3: The lost balloon decided to drift away on an adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would drift like clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The dandelion seeds would drift in the breeze, spreading far and wide.

meanings.definition: A gradual deviation from an original course or position.
meanings.sent1: The slow drift of the ship off course was unnoticed by the crew.
meanings.sent2: The gradual drift of the continents over millions of years shaped the Earth's landscape.
meanings.sent3: The drift of the car into the wrong lane caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: The drift of the conversation towards politics made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The subtle drift of the clouds across the sky painted a beautiful scene.

meanings.sent1: The drift of the story was clear from the beginning.
meanings.sent2: The overall drift of the meeting was positive and productive.
meanings.sent3: The drift of the joke left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The drift of the music carried the listeners to a different world.
meanings.sent5: The general drift of the market indicated a downturn in sales.
